turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Battle of the Windmill.
turn.1: What was the Battle of the Windmill?
turn.2: Battle of the Windmill The Battle of the Windmill was a battle fought in November 1838 in the aftermath of the Upper Canada Rebellion.
turn.3: What was the result of the battle?
turn.4: Loyalist forces of the Upper Canadian government and American troops, aided by the Royal Navy and U.S. Navy, defeated an invasion attempt by a Hunter Patriot para-military unit based in the United States, which had the intention of using the beachhead as a launchpad for further offensives into Canada.
turn.6: Canadian, British, and American troops thwarted the invasion, successfully defending Canadian soil and forced the invaders to surrender.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Others still in the U.S. were captured and arrested by U.S. officials.
turn.9: Why did they settle in the US?
turn.10: After a rebellion by disaffected Upper Canadians was suppressed in 1837, the majority of the rebel leaders fled to the United States.
turn.12: Popular sentiment in the States held that Canadians were eager to overthrow British rule and form a republic patterned after the American model.
